info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 7:26PM PDT until August 26 at 7:15AM PDT by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial.
* WHEN...Until 715 AM PDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 725 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported that State Route 98 is closed due to flooding across the roadway. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Calexico, Mt. Signal and Heber. - This includes the following highways... CA Route 98 between mile markers 13 and 22. CA Route 111 between mile markers 1 and 6. CA Route 86 between mile markers 1 and 4. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM PDT TUESDAY
